You are given a line of $n$ cells, each containing either a '<' or a '>' character.  A pinball is placed on each cell, one at a time.  

When the pinball is on a cell with a '<', it moves one cell to the left. When it is on a cell with a '>', it moves one cell to the right.

After each move, the character in the cell is flipped ( '<' becomes '>' and '>' becomes '<').

The pinball continues moving until it reaches the edge of the line.

For each cell, determine how many seconds it takes for the pinball to leave the line. 



Input:

* The first line contains the number of test cases, $t$.
* For each test case:
    * The first line contains the number of cells, $n$.
    * The second line contains a string of $n$ characters, each either '<' or '>', representing the initial state of the line.

Output:

* For each test case, output $n$ numbers, each representing the number of seconds it takes for the pinball to leave the line when placed on the corresponding cell.

You are given a line of characters, each character is either '<' or '>'.  A ball starts at a given position on the line. If the character is '<', the ball moves one position to the left. If the character is '>', the ball moves one position to the right. After each move, the character is flipped. The ball keeps moving until it reaches the edge of the line. For each starting position, determine how many moves it takes for the ball to leave the line.
